data.value: If you like Medieval Engineers, can recommend it to Steam friends on the following page. Recommendations help to grow the community. Thank you!

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsStructuralSimulation
data.value: Buildings can fall under their own weight. If a building support is damaged, it can cause the building to collapse.

data.name: TooltipScreenGraphicsOptions_ShadowQuality
data.value: Choose the quality of shadows or disable them completely.

data.name: TooltipScreenGraphicsOptions_AmbientOcclusion
data.value: Ambient occlusion simulates shadows cast by light scattering and secondary light sources. - HBAO is the best method but is more expensive. - SSAO is a faster method, with worse results. - Disabling AO can lead to some performance improvement, especially on weaker hardware.

data.name: TooltipScreenGraphicsOptions_AmbientOcclusion_HBAO
data.value: HBAO is the best method but is more expensive.

data.name: TooltipScreenGraphicsOptions_AmbientOcclusion_SSAO
data.value: SSAO is a faster method, with worse results.

data.name: TooltipScreenGraphicsOptions_AmbientOcclusion_Disabled
data.value: Disabling AO can lead to some performance improvement, especially on weaker hardware.

data.name: WorldSettings_SeasonDuration_Tooltip
data.value: The duration of each season, measured in days.

data.name: WorldSettings_SolarAltitude_Tooltip
data.value: The maximum angle of the sun, compared to the equator, measured in degrees.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsDayDuration
data.value: The length of days, measured in minutes.

data.name: DialogAmount_SetValueMinutesCaption
data.value: Value to set, measured in minutes.

data.name: LobbyJoin_GameInvite

data.value: The character's name is now hidden

data.name: NotificationCharacterBroadcastingOn
data.value: The character's name is now visible

data.name: NotificationHintJoystickEditRopeRelease
data.value: Go to control menu in order to edit rope settings

data.name: NotificationHintJoystickPressToUseWardrobe
data.value: Access control menu in order to change appearance

data.name: NotificationEditLockableDrum
data.value: Hold {0} to configure the Rope Drum.

data.name: ScreenLockableDrum_MinLengthError
data.value: Minimum length must be less than maximum length.

data.name: Inventory_ContextualHelp
data.value:
Inventory Controls Double-click: Move item stack to the next inventory. Shift-click: Move all items of selected type to the next inventory. Ctrl-click: Move half of the item stack to the next inventory. Alt-click: Move one item from stack to the next inventory.
Right-click: Activate Item. Right-click drag: Move half of the item stack. Ctrl + right-click drag: Drag an item and enter the amount to move.

data.name: Crafting_ContextualHelp
data.value:
Crafting Controls Double-click recipe: Add recipe to queue. Ctrl + double-click: Add recipe to queue 5 times. Shift + double-click: Add recipe to queue 10 times. Shift + Ctrl + double-click: Add recipe to queue 15 times. These modifiers also work for the craft button.
Right-click production queue: Remove item from production queue.

data.name: Map_ContextualHelp
data.value:
Click on the areas on the globe to the left to select the different kingdoms on the planet. Double-click on a region on the map to zoom into an area. Right-click on the map to zoom back out to region overview.
Green shields indicate areas owned by you. Blue shields indicate areas owned by allies. The money bag icon indicates there are taxes about to run out. The red arrows indicate that there is conflict in this region or area.
The House/tower/castle icon indicates there are constructions in this area.
Click the fast travel button to enable fast travel mode.

data.name: DialogText_QuestionLeavingLobby
data.value: Do you really want to leave the castle siege lobby?

data.name: NotificationHintPressToPlaceFromInventory
data.value: Press {0} to place projectile from inventory.

data.name: ScreenSpawn_ItemAmountTooltip
data.value:
Number of items to spawn / add to inventory.
Accepts a number between {0} and {1}.

data.value: Cycle through areas with ongoing combat.

data.name: ToolTip_Map_UpkeepButton
data.value: Cycle through areas that have taxes near expiration.

data.name: ToolTip_Map_FastTravelButton
data.value: Fast Travel is used to cover long distances. In advanced world options it can be disabled completely and travel limitations can be turned on and off. Travel limitations limit travel to only those areas with roads. Enemies can block roads from fast travel by claiming areas on the road. The traversable area can be extended by building claim blocks in adjacent areas.

data.name: Faction_Permission_EditFactionBanner_Tooltip

data.name: ScreenFaction_Ranks_Subtitle_Label_Tooltip
data.value: Ranks can be created with unique permissions for each rank. Members can then be added to these ranks to assign those permissions to them. Members of lower ranks cannot control higher ranks.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Item_ShowUsageTooltip
data.value: Ctrl-click to show what this is used for.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Tab_Settings_Tooltip
data.value: Settings Contains general search screen settings.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Tab_Help_Tooltip
data.value: Help and Information Contains general search screen help and information.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Tab_Advanced_Tooltip
data.value: Advanced Search Contains a list of advanced search parameters.

data.name: ScreenSearch_AddBookmark_Tooltip
data.value: Create a bookmark with your current search string.

data.name: ScreenSearch_ResetBookmarks_Tooltip
data.value: Clicking this will reset your bookmarks to their default values.

data.name: ScreenSearch_ResetBookmarksConfirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to reset your bookmarks to the defaults? This will remove all of your custom bookmarks in the process.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Error_NotAvailableInSurvival
data.value: None of the returned results are usable in Survival Mode.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Error_NotResearched
data.value: None of the returned results are usable without being researched first.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Help_UsageDescription
data.value: Enter search parameters into the box at the top of the screen to to find blocks and items in the game. Click the advanced search tab on the right for a list of search parameters.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Help_LimitationsDescription
data.value:
Not all blocks and items are available in every game mode. In survival mode, many blocks and items are unknown to the character until they have been learned through research.
Search limitations can be disabled in the settings tab to the right by unchecking "Only Show Available". Doing this is a good way to learn about blocks and items that are not yet known by the character.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Help_ToolbarDescription
data.value: Blocks and items can be dragged to the toolbar. This includes all large blocks and any small blocks or items that are in the character's inventory. See block and item tooltips for additional controls.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Help_BookmarksDescription
data.value:
Search bookmarks are on the left side of the screen and they can be customized. Create a new bookmark by searching for what you want and then clicking the + below the last bookmark. Give it a name and click OK.
Shift+Click on bookmarks to delete them.
Restore the default bookmarks by clicking the ? button, clicking the settings tab on the right side of the screen, and clicking the "Restore Bookmarks" button.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Settings_OnlyShowAvailable_Tooltip
data.value: Only show items and blocks that have been unlocked through research.

data.name: ScreenSearch_Settings_AdvancedTooltips_Tooltip
data.value:
Displays the following additional information at the bottom of tooltips: - Definition ID's - Item tags - Mod information
Notice: Not all of these are applicable to each result.

data.name: Description_Search_SingleString
data.value:
This search prefix matches names including whitespace.
Example: '{0}Stone Cube' will find everything that has the phrase 'Stone Cube' in the name, including any spaces.

data.name: Description_Search_SplitString
data.value:
This search prefix matches names.
Example: 'Stone Cube' and 'Cube Stone' will return the 'Stone Cube' block.

data.name: Description_Search_Type
data.value:
This search prefix matches item types.
Example: '{0}Item' will find anything that has the word 'item' in its type, like EquipmentItem, HandItem, or ConsumableItem.

data.name: Description_Search_Block
data.value:
This search prefix matches block sizes.
Example: '{0}Large' will find all large grid blocks.

data.name: Description_Search_Mod
data.value:
This search prefix matches mod names.
Example: '{0}Hats' will find everything that came with the mod that has the word 'Hats' somewhere in its name.

data.name: Description_Search_Tag
data.value:
This search prefix matches tags.
Example: '{0}Ingot' will find every item and block that is tagged as 'Ingot'.

data.name: Description_Search_Category
data.value:
This search prefix matches category names.
Example: '{0}Wall' will find everything that is contained within any category that has the word 'Wall' in its name.

data.name: Description_Search_Usage
data.value:
This search prefix matches names. It then lists every other item or block in the game, that can be crafted by using the block or item matching the string.
Example: '{0}Log' will find every item or block that uses an item named 'Log' for building or crafting.
